abstract: Election officials report that Almazbek Atambayev, former prime minister of Kyrgyzstan, is poised to win presidential election with about 60 percent of the vote; many hope that election will bring an end to years of ethnic and regional turmoil between the ethnic Kyrgyz and minority Uzbek, which had erupted in violence in April 2010.
snippet: Almazbek Atambayev, a former prime minister, was poised to become president of Kyrgyzstan by voters seeking an end to the ethnic and regional turmoil that erupted in violence last year.
lead_paragraph: Almazbek Atambayev, a former prime minister, was poised to become president of Kyrgyzstan by voters seeking an end to the ethnic and regional turmoil that erupted in violence last year.

headline.main: Hopes for Peace as Kyrgyzstan Votes for New President
headline.print_headline: Hopes for Peace as Kyrgyzstan Votes for New President
headline.seo: Kyrgyzstan Votes for President, Hopes for Peace
